turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Good morning, how are you/

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Pretty good, how about yourself?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Not to bad

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: So, have you ever donated to a charity for children before?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I've dropped a few coins in the jar at the grocers, but nothing more than that

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Well even that is very helpful. All those coins really add up!

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I imagine it does, how about you

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: I sponsor a little boy in India. It's about $40 a month. I would sponsor so many more, but it's really all I can afford.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: That's quite the humanitarian effort, good on you

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Thanks! It's really gratifying. They send me pictures and videos of him and his family, and let me know exactly where my money is going. I was hoping you would be interested in supporting another great organization, Save the Children. They are also really trustworthy. Your donation to them helps ensure children's right to health, education, safety, etc.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: My willingness to donate to charities is always reliant on my current financial situation, currently my finances are fairly unstable and I need every penny that I can scrounge up. Perhaps in the future when I have more disposable income I would be willing to undertake such a proposal, but sadly right now I cannot.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: I know exactly how you feel. I've been sick with cancer for about 12 years now. We pretty much live paycheck to paycheck. But I felt so useless sometimes, I decided I would make it work. So I do these little side jobs in order to pay for sponsoring my Indian boy.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Yes, paycheck to paycheck, the story of my life, and imagine doing this in order to eat, But that's not what we are here to discuss, we need to come to some sort of resolution about this donation. How do we go about that?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Well, just so you know, they are not looking for a large donation. You can donate any amount, up to your total payment, which will be $2 after bonus. Even just 5 cents would be acceptable. Would that be okay with you?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Sure 5 cents is fine

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: That's awesome. The research team collects all donations and sends them directly to Save the Children. And like I said before, many small donations adds up to a lot. Thank you so much!

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: No problem. If I could ask, before we end this, are you a random person or someone who works for the researcher

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: The rules of the survey keep me from answering. But thank you again. And I sincerely hope your financial situation improves big time for you!

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: It was nice talking to you either way, you seem like a cool person. Have a great day.
